scenarioDescription:
The KMT-2019-BLG-0371L Exoplanetary System


Overview

KMT-2019-BLG-0371L is a star with 0.09 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 22863.54 light years away from the solar system.

KMT-2019-BLG-0371L is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the KMT-2019-BLG-0371L system


KMT-2019-BLG-0371L b

KMT-2019-BLG-0371L b was discovered by the KMTNet observatory, in 2021-07, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 0.79 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of KMT-2019-BLG-0371L b is 2448.600 times the mass of Earth. The radius of KMT-2019-BLG-0371L b is 12.600 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, KMT-2019-BLG-0371L b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system KMT-2019-BLG-0371L, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the KMTNet.
name: KMT-2019-BLG-0371L - System With 1 Exoplanet
